meanings.definition: The main or principal stage in a theater.
meanings.sent1: The mainstage was brightly lit for the play.
meanings.sent2: The actors performed on the mainstage in front of the audience.
meanings.sent3: The mainstage seemed to be the star of the show, stealing the spotlight.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams took center stage, like the mainstage in a grand theater.
meanings.sent5: The mainstage stood tall and proud, commanding attention from all.

meanings.definition: The primary or central area of a music festival or event.
meanings.sent1: The mainstage at the concert had colorful lights and huge speakers.
meanings.sent2: The crowd cheered as the band took the mainstage to perform.
meanings.sent3: The mainstage was like a magnet, drawing music lovers closer.
meanings.sent4: The mainstage was a beacon of excitement in the sea of festival tents.
meanings.sent5: The mainstage throbbed with energy, setting the tone for the entire event.

meanings.definition: To feature or highlight prominently on a main stage.
meanings.sent1: The director decided to mainstage the lead actor for the final scene.
meanings.sent2: She mainstaged the new product launch to attract more customers.
meanings.sent3: The magician mainstaged his disappearing act, leaving the audience in awe.
meanings.sent4: The artist mainstaged her latest masterpiece at the gallery opening.
meanings.sent5: He mainstaged his talent, leaving everyone impressed with his skills.
